body_html:
RIght, the issue is that calling cumsum with the reverse flag set to True on a tensor that is being reversed returns the wrong value. So to your point:

w = tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v,[True]), reverse=True)

is NOT the same as

q = tf.reverse(tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v[True])))
body_text:
RIght, the issue is that calling cumsum with the reverse flag set to True on a tensor that is being reversed returns the wrong value.  So to your point:
w = tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v,[True]), reverse=True)
is NOT the same as
q = tf.reverse(tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v[True])))
body:
RIght, the issue is that calling cumsum with the reverse flag set to True on a tensor that is being reversed returns the wrong value.  So to your point:

``` python
w = tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v,[True]), reverse=True)
```

is NOT the same as

``` python
q = tf.reverse(tf.cumsum(tf.reverse(v[True])))
```
